reviews.text: Gave me food poisoning on 10/7/2022. Food was good but must have been infected with something. Will not return. Thank god it didn’t ruin our trip. Also, $17 for a burrito and drink is outrageous, even for DC, considering you can get more food for $12 at the Panda Express down the way…

The worker put half a spoonful of chicken in my bowl. It was a very tiny amount. It wasn’t a even proportion, then when I asked for more chicken she put only a tiny bit more. I had to ask for more again. I was charged $3 extra. There wasn’t even amounts of toppings.
Food was cold and either had gone bad or was sitting out for too long because also had a strange smell. Was so bad we did not eat the bowls because we were scared of getting sick. Do better

It appeared clean while placing order but as my daughter began to eat, after about 5 minutes into it she found a long piece of hair in her food. Things happen nothing is perfect but long hair in food is unacceptable and shows you are not taking steps necessary to maintain a clean environment while handling food people pay for to eat.

I Love Chipotle brand. but here is worst... so sad... good thing is only in place in Pentagon city so that's why can keep earn the money here.
😫😫😫 Please take care food condition

Rice so thick, hard to eat and not warm
feel like last week made this and bread not warm
I don't need ice Chipotle 😭😭😭
Sorry for there but I don't want go there
Staff is okay but food is not good

Reservations recommended. This was in Crystal City, VA. Otherwise, known as Arlington, VA. Surprisingly parking (underground) was free. Short walk to elevators. Good signing for directions. Remember where U park!
As for food and service, it was great. No one had any complaints about their order. The only downside for me was no beer on draft. And beer 🍺 selection was limited. My steak was perfectly cooked, medium-rare. The waiter was on top of everything for a party of 8, including 3 kids. Recommended if U have the $$$.
Not cheap but nice for special occasions.
This location has an incredible view for your fine dining experience. Brian was our   waiter and nothing but quality service. Apps and steaks were perfect. Didn't disappoint.

Teddy deserves 5 stars.  His service is exceptional.  These days you never know what service will be... Teddy is professional and personable.  I enjoyed my meal because of him.  However, not impressed.  The salmon was ok.  Lemon drop lackluster.  Broccoli was fresh.  Chocolate mousse not worth the calories or "sugar cheat".  I'm convinced the only Ruth Chris I'll visit in the future will be Fort Myers (Bonita Springs).  The food, manager,  and service are unmatched in Bonita Springs.  Although Teddy is an exception here in Crystal city.  He is amazing.

We had an incredible experience dining here for NYE this past year. Our server Brian was fantastic. His level of professionalism and knowledge of the entire menu was extremely impressive. He made sure we were taken care of from the moment we were seated until our meal was finished. Our family will definitely be returning to this Ruth’s Chris on our next visit to D.C.  Thank you again Brian and Ruth’s Chris team for an outstanding evening.

Very nice. Tried the Calamari, Filet with Baked Potato, and the King Samon - all very delicious! Offers a beautiful view of the city skyline if you can sit by the window.

The only reason I didn't give 5 stars is that parking is scarce, and we ended up paying valet for just a parking spot but not for the valet service.

A solid afternoon happy hour this side of the Potomac, with really good prices and really tasty food!

Seafood seems to be the specialty of the location, and their taco special (and especially Taco Tuesdays) are a treat. To be fair they were a bit dry, but they'll bring you homemade sauces if you'd like! The calamari appetizer is pretty good as well.

Atmosphere is pretty nice. Modern place, indy and classical rock, great place to chill.

The only negative was the service. Wasn't rude or anything, but the seems like there was a single waitress for the entire place, and not only took a while, but she missed part of our order. Nothing major, but it was definitely a letdown.

All in all, slow service aside, excellent happy hour!

Convenient location near Reagan Airport. The lobster bisque and clam chowder are both amazing. The pan seared striped bass is excellent! They have a large selection of wines.  I deducted one star because they try to sell you the Landry Club membership at the end of the meal.

We went to McCormick & Schmick’s for a birthday dinner. Our server was attentive and really knew the menu items to answer our questions. Our drinks remained full and our meals were delicious.
Save room for dessert. The pineapple brown butter cake is fantastic!!

There was a special event going on when I visited the place so, getting seated then served, took a while. The place is neat and the food was above average and all in, pricey! They have a nice bar, but it was packed with the event guests :( Parking could be a bit challenging there.

I usually don't try places below 4 stars, but decided to give this one a shot out of location convenience. I regret it.

Negatives: I waited over 30 minutes for my appetizer of 6 oysters. My lobster tail was incredibly overcooked. The potatoes were soggy. The fries were soggy and cold. For an over $100 meal I was incredibly disappointed.

Positives: my server was incredibly friendly and attentive, including apologetic for how long it took the oysters to come out. Additionally the drinks were delicious and strong, and pretty fast. So props to the bar and staff!

Overall: won't be coming back, 2-stars only due to the good service and drinks.

name: Asia Bistro
vicinity: 1301 South Joyce Street Suite D7, Arlington

reviews.text:
An excellent sushi place that punches above its weight, especially with ramen. I visited close to its closing time, late at night, and both the food and the service were as good as if they were just opening.

They've got a well-stocked bar and table service, and the place has an overall modern vibe, great for an evening meet with friends or colleagues. Highly recommend the rolls and the pork belly ramen!

As always, they do not disappoint. I love their food. Great Ramen in the winter and wonderful and fresh poke bowls in the summer.
If you need a place that has so many different options, this is your place.

Thank you always, Asia Bistro.

After a day of museums and memorials, we were looking for a place to sit and eat. My wife and daughter won rock, paper, scissors and we ate here. Not bad. Would like a few more vegetarian options, but not bad. We had the Shrimp & Veggie Tempura, for an appetizer, that they forgot to bring to us. So we got it mid-meal. We asked they leave the shrimp off and give us only veggies, which they did, but we didn’t get any extra veggies. So bummed at that.

Son got the Pad Thai with tofu and a Mango Tango tea. He loved the food, disliked the tea.

I got the LoMein Noodles and a Mango Tango Tea. I liked both, would have liked the noodles to have a little more flavor.

Wife got the Drunken Noodles with tofu and a So Peachy Tea. She loved both.

Daughter got the Malaysian Noodles and a Brown Sugar Milk Tea and was the only one eating with Chopstix. She was in heaven!

Kind of expensive, but we were right next to Wash DC! In the future, if we Rock, Paper, Scissors and I win - we’ll be going somewhere else!  :)

OK food for the value.

Had a Poke bowl here a few times and it’s yummy. I see others ordering sushi, ramen or hot entrees. The poke bowl is tasty with Fresh tuna and fixings. Family owned and there is cooler seating inside or outdoor seating. Boba Thai tea also hits the spot.

Food about ok. But service was poor. Me and friends went there wasn’t in their rush hour. Just couple of tables occupied and no people stand in line. But the waitress came many times to collect all plates. Also she gave us the bill immediately while we were still talking and collected the bill so fast after we signed it. We seat in the restaurant less than an hour. Is there “one hour limit” in this restaurant？

This is a walkable area restaurant. Parking is on the street for $3/2-hour or more expensive in a parking garage. This restaurant serves Pepsi products. The Buffalo Chicken Wrap was very good. Lots of fries. Service could have been much better. Handicap bathroom stall was out of order. Regular stalls have very low toilets which make it difficult for a handicapped person to use. Probably will not return even though it's in our neighborhood.

Worst Buffalo Wild Wings I have ever been to. Came in no service to be found and had to track down ourselves. Group of guest behind us turned around and asked us if this was self service. Two female employees that I tracked down and inquired about service had attitudes, looked at me crazy, and we’re not at all personable. We observed guests after guests walking in with the same confused look standing waiting to be seated. Absolutely terrible service.

My husband went to the washroom and came back traumatized: toilet paper everywhere, the sink coming off the wall, only hot water working smell like raw sewage, etc.

Tables were not wiped down, brooms left out leaning against tables, etc, For the area, an absolute disgrace and misrepresentation of Buffalo Wild Wings franchise. We saw family and friends of the servers arrive and be seated in no time as well as receive their food ahead of us.

In the words of our comrades in arms at the table next to us: well this has been quite the experience. The only saving grace? Our eventual server Juan.

We came here to watch a Football World Cup game. Chicken wings were not available but we did have a good honey bbq pizza instead. There are big TV screens to watch sport games. Good beer! Wild Herd Kolsch by Goose Island for 3 usd per glass.

I came in on a whim from having a rough day, and I did the wing challenge. 10 bone-in Carolina reapers in 5 minutes. I had a whole 1:30 for the last wing and enjoyed it wholly. I assure that it's not the heat to worry about; it's the digestion. Look out for the next-day effects. Real talk, the ice cream is worth it, plus you get a headband that you can wear like a Shinobi cosplayer. These fries are just great!. They also offer you a glass of milk on the house. It was a great experience.
They forgot our cheese curds on our pick up order. They were able to return the money. The lemon pepper wings have almost no seasoning and taste like chicken tenders.

Simply the best! most diverse, beautiful dancers, good food, great drinks, friendly atmosphere, close to Metro station, great prices, great music and sound. I have been to this place couple of times before but last night was unforgettable.

Every 3-4 mins a dancer comes by to collect $1. It’s annoying when I am having dinner.
80% of dancers are super low quality.
Private dance is expensive. The girls are hustling for extra tips.

A nice Adult onily club lots hot and pretty woman bring money to tip them lots of fun.Food is good music good staff good this a fun place to go. Yes this is a Adult Onily club this is a strip club but lots of fun

2022 Update: Standing on stage and talking to one of other staff does not count as dancing or entertainment.

The place used to be a lot better.  The quality of the entertainers has gone way down.  Few actually dance anymore...they just kinda sway to the music and expect to be admired.  The food is below average bar-food, but does not suck.  The prices are reasonable.
I live next to this place. I moved back recently and it's awesome.  The same food for fast food prices and Jose Andre's menus.  This does come with adult entertainment so no children.

Was craving some Pho and Saigon Saigon did not disappoint. Absolutely delicious food that came with a fun plate of basil, bean sprouts, hot peppers, and so on to add to your soup, if you wish. The chicken satay appetizer was also very nicely seasoned and went well with the homemade peanut sauce.

We were seated right away and we were surprised there weren't very many customers when we arrived. We ordered and the food didn't take too long. The flavors of the dishes were really good. My only complaint is that no staff came back by our table to refill water for a long long time. It's a minor thing, but with very few patrons in the place I'm not sure why it happened.

The food really is good and I do recommend trying it out.

+++MUST+++ try this restaurant. Specially in winter. It is so delicious. The service is great and there is plenty of seating. The parking is hard on the street. I would recommend it. I like mine with red sauce to make it spicy. Plenty of condiments to put it in your soup.

First time in the city and at the restaurant. It was nice to have some hot soup on this really cold day. Having driven through a lot of cities and states where Vietnamese food was not available it was very refreshing to see something I'm so used to in Toronto. Food was good not great and prices in USD were a bit more expensive than what I'm used to. However, it was great to experience the amount of diversity that is in DC, especially when it comes to food.

I got Garden Rolls and Pho with beef. The roll was delicious. The pho was good, too. The flavor of the soup was superb. However, the noodles were disappointing, as they were too soft and bunched together. When I picked them up with chopsticks, they broke apart into short pieces, which was disappointing as noodles are one of the main parts of the dish. Nevertheless, overall it was good, and I would love to come back and try again. Very reasonably priced, too!

First time here. Very busy. I wouldn’t recommend order from DoorDash at all long time wait, but very good dishes. By far the best afghan food I ever taste 🤤😋. A little spicy if you ask me. I love it though. And the best part they are open 24hrs 7 days a week.

My friend and I were looking for place to get a good meal before going to DCA airport. This location is VERY convenient to the airport. The staff member who fixed our plates was very nice and didn't mind explaining what we were ordering. There may have been a slight language barrier with the cashier but it was nothing to complain about. I got the LAMB Kabobs. The Lamb was cooked so nicely and the chickpea stew with rice paired well with it. I have never eaten at place like this but I love going to DC and I will definitely eat here again in the future. I didn't feel sluggish after the meal and overall, it was a great experience. We didn't have an issue with parking but I could see how it may be a challenge during a busier time of day.

Kabob Palace was fantastic! You know you’re going to have good food when you go to a small restaurant with a ginormous line and a bunch of people waiting to pick up the food. The lamb kabob that I had was marinated to a point where every bite felt fresh. The sides were also superb. The bread and green sauce were also super delightful. It looked a lot of food but I was surprised to have finished it all in a single sitting. Not sure if it was because I was hungry or the food was great!

This place just feels like home. ♥️

The food is unbelievably delicious.

You should order the family combo that comes with lamb kababs, chicken and lamb skewers, and 2 sides of whatever you want from beans, more chicken and lamb stews. 🥘

I would recommend to hire more staff for the cleaning and waitering, but in general, I would recommend it. 👍🏼

This is my must go spot on every Friday!!
The best place to eat Pakistani/Afghan food in the entire DMV, most of the kabab made in front of you, you can see how fresh and clean is your food, the place is small, the food is so delicious the staff are friendly and kind.
I highly recommend this place.

Ordered a salad for the first time among other things, and they forgot the dressing. There were fruits inside it, tried shaking it thinking the dressing was inside, but nothing. I checked the website for ingredients and truly so, it was supposed to come with a dressing. Annoyed, half angry and with a dry mouth, I went back and asked that my salad be refunded because I had a terrible experience with it. She said because I had half of it, and didn’t realize from the first two bites that it was missing, I don’t get a refund (pic attached). Needless to say, I was taking bites while I was scrolling through their website looking for the salad, but she wasn’t ready to hear any excuses, not now, maybe not ever. I asked to speak to someone else because I didn’t think she was being very helpful, but the manager wouldn’t come out and speak to me. Defeated, but head held high, I refused the offer for the dressing, left them the salad on the table and left. I could no longer enjoy their food after experiencing such terrible attitude towards a customer.

Spoke with Carol “Team Leader in training” who was interruptive, generally dismissive,  and, I don’t think handled the situation very well at all.

Hands down the best fast food restaurant that sells chicken burgers. ♥️

Get the original (number 1) meal with extra Chick Fil-A sauce. You won’t regret it. 🐔

This branch is a little busy during the week, but I could tell that the staff is so well-trained and managed the overwhelming orders.

The employee in charge of pick up orders tonight was incredibly rude. Blatantly ignoring customers. This was unlike any 'Chick-fil-A experience' I've ever had. I have visited this location regularly for the past year, but this experience was very undesirable. The employee was speaking rudely to other employees as well as customers. There was a build up of pick up customers, but he ignored us until people physically walked into the 'employees only' area. There were missing items and incorrect items with my order. This occurred on a Thursday evening, not a frantic weekend day/night. I wasn't the only customer with issues with their order. So, I cannot recommend this location.

Chick-fil-A is simply the best fast food restaurant there is. There’s no other fast food restaurant that can top it. The food of course is simply great with having a much better tasting experience with better food than like say McDonald’s and Taco-Bell.  The chicken sandwiches top with the chic-fil-a sauce is simply too good to pass up.Not to mention the service as the employees are very friendly and are very responsive to questions and orders which is great for a work environment. Other wise I really enjoyed my experience there at Chick-fil-a

The food is great, the staff is friendly and timely, the premises are clean, and service is fast. So why am I taking out a star? The drive-thru line goes into the roadways for the shopping complex.

There is no other way for the waiting customers to line up their cars. This is not user error, it is unbelievably bad planning and was shortsighted to the extreme. I see the teo lanes were intended to improve this, but they have not. The parking lot needs a few adjustments. Right now, it is a safety hazard for drivers, pedestrians, and unrelated motorists alike.

I had the taste for a salad.  I ordered a Cobb Salad to go from Chevys Pentagon City, Arlington, Virginia location.

I chose the apple-vinaigrette dressing, which paired perfectly with my salad.  It was sweet and tangy.  Heck it was all around the delicious.

My salad consisted of chicken, avocado, roasted corn, roasted red peppers, bacon,blue cheese, and iceberg lettuce.

It was a nice size portion.

My order also came with complimentary chips, salsa and utensils.

I love the flavor combinations and will definitely go back.

Some of the best home made salsa out there. The food was good. However,  the service was very good. Try the raspberry tea. It too was delicious. This is our 2nd time here due to the convenience,  location, service and the food.
Big space, bright interior, a bit loud. Not sure if a romantic date would be good here. But overall it’s lively there, the staff is very attentive. My salad was SUPER big and very delicious.

I live nearby and finally visited this place for my birthday. I ordered their mixed fajitas and it was good. Worth the money!! Since I try to avoid eat rice they’re kind enough to replace mine with fries. Also ordered mango margaritas and it was perfect. The server is so kind and can’t wait to come back again!

The drinks were delicious! Never tried Cointreau noir shot before!! Definitely very happy for trying and thankfully for the place to “show” me haha! we were 10/10 served, costumer service impeccable!!! overall really happy for the experience even tho the tamale wasn’t what I was expecting (the ones I tried in Guadalajara were different… could be because regional different way to make it). It was super cool to have courtesy nacho chips and tomato dip! The taco, chicken flautes and sweetcorn tamalilo was fenomenal! Definitely would come back another time!!!

Valentine’s month date night! We were feeling fancy so we got some steak and wine! Restaurant’s ambiance was on point, very clean and fine! Food was great! We had spinach and mashed potato for our sides, dessert was so good! Definitely had a great time!

My husband surprized me with a reservation for our anniversary. We arrived and the valet nicely took our car to park it for us. Were quickly seated. Our waiter was such a sweet young lady. We thoroughly enjoyed the wagyu meatballs. My steak came out very hot and seasoning, delicious.  She was very attentive, and service was by far the best. Scott made our night memorable by having our picture taken. We also loved the key lime pie. We will be coming back soon.  Thank you Scott!
Wow, exceptional. Julio @ Cyrstal City did an amazing job, serving,explaining the meats and how they are prepared. His passion for food brought a smile across my face. Truly an amazing experience!!!

Nice place, good food, but be ready to spend some money.  I tried not to like this restaurant but couldn't find any part of our meal to hate on.  The crabcakes were tasty, very little filler, and a lot of flavor.  We tried the meatball appetizer too, and that was good, nice portion and flavor combination.   Filet mignon and Manhattan cut were a nice thickness, tender, well seasoned, and cooked to temp.  My creme brulee was delicious.  The bread pudding had walnuts, which I do not like, but that's my preference, even so it's a yummy bread pudding, warm and comforting.  Even the complementary onion and poppy seed bread was delicious, so I saved some and had it with coffee the next day.   The wine, Stag's Leap, was expensive but very smooth and rich without being heavy on the pallette and complimented our meal very well.  Service was great as well; our server seemed a little awkward but had great suggestions and was attentive while still giving my husband and me time and space to chat and enjoy the food.
The only, tiny thing I wasn't loving was their website stated there was a dress code so we dressed for the occasion, but it clearly was not an enforced code which made it look and feel more like a casual, everyday restaurant as opposed to fine dining, not a biggie and not taking any stars or respect from the restaurant, just an observation and a me thing.
So why not 5 stars?  My husband always says no one gets 5 stars; this would imply they are perfect and have nothing else to improve on.  That said, prices here were on the higher end, almost feeling over-priced.  Our table placement felt like we were in the way of restaurant traffic, not very intimate and cozy.
Overall, I went in with low expectations and tried to hate it but couldn't and ended up enjoying the experience as a whole; we'll definitely be back!
I was surprised with this restaurant for my birthday, and I enjoyed everything that we got. The filet mignon was so soft. The best side on the menu that you have to try is the lobster Mac and cheese.

Consistently great.    I strongly recommend that you put yourself in the servers hands and tell them basically your likes and dislikes.  They will take care of you in a delicious and reasonable way each time.  Their customer service should give lessons, truly feel like family.
Chefs platter and baklava pictured are sure things.  They may even do an off menu of your favorite if not busy…..    great staff great food

Overall the food was pretty good a few things missed. The spreads platter we got was good and dipping with bread tasted good. The service was a little slow. Got costco gift cards to dine here which makes the place more affordable. The salmon harra was good. The lamb kabob was also good. The waiter was very friendly also.

I could not find anything wrong with this place and it doesn’t have the “chain” vibe that tends to kill ingredient freshness and versatility. The food was outstanding - ingredients were high-quality and extremely fresh. The service was outstanding, and I had enough leftovers for days!!

We were in crystal city area for work and wanted some good Lebanese food. This place did not disappoint! We ordered hummus tabouleh halloumi and lentil soup as appetizer. For main we had kafta and lamb kebob. This was truly authentic good and service was quick. My only complaint is they did not have Foul M'Damas which is my favorite appetizer. Overall I would highly recommend this place!

Chef’s plater which was combo with nine different appetizers. All of them were really good. We also ordered Eggplant fatteh. I have heard about this dish from a Lebanese friend before, so I had plan to try it. It was interesting, it was good but not wow.
I do recommend this place.

My friend and I Went for happy hour on Thursday night. The happy hour prices were great. I ordered 2 absolute and pineapples along with some fried pickles and beefy bites. They were soo good. The owner Freddie also stopped in and he was so sweet. Hadn’t seen him in since Easter of 2016.

Excellent time! Everyone there was friendly and nice, what a wonderful time. The bartender was great - the flashing flamingo is hilarious as a drink and I love it. There is a 24 hour diner right down the way as well for the after drinking munchies so it has a great location.

this is why I love the lgbtq+ community coming from a straight person. everyone in there was so sweet, nice, and thoughtful. The host was hyping me up. she’s the cutest ever omg. we sat down got a bunch of food. food was delicious. i would definitely come here again and support this business. thank you

Went for brunch today with 2 friends. We had such a great time! I walked in and everyone was so nice and friendly. The food was your typical buffet food and was prepared well. Just enough of a selection that you weren’t overwhelmed. They had a jazz quintet which was very nice. I’ll definitely be returning.

These folks have the best weekend brunch I've been to. Plenty of drinks, live music, a great crowd, friendly staff, and a varied all you can eat buffet makes it perfect for a morning (or early afternoon) hangout.

name: Zen Bistro & Wine Bar
vicinity: 1301 South Joyce Street Ste D9, Arlington

reviews.text: Run, don't walk, to get some of the best salsa you've ever had!! Perfect notes of sweetness, and the heat is a tasteful flavor rather than the main star. The Seaweed is delicious as well, especially when mixed with the salsa. You pay once and the salsa keeps coming. Our main dishes were superb as well, but we were so hungry I forgot to get a picture! Highly recommend the Atlantic salmon.

Zen Bistro & Wine Bar was great: refreshing, made in-house, not too sweet. The local beer on draft was also on point. The chips and salsa appetizer were solid. Salsa was tangy and flavorful, but pretty mild. Chips were crispy, fresh, salty. The tamale dinner special was outstanding. The Extra sashimi fish was hearty and tender. The dish included some novel ingredients, like fresh arugula, but all the flavors worked together perfectly.
I would give this place a 10! Food was amazing! So, so good. We got sushi and we will definitely be back. Staff is super friendly and prices were reasonable.

I had the wonton crisps and Seaweed salad, Tuna and Onion crisps. All were hits! The chips were hot and crispy and the salsa was fresh and delicious. With a good balance of ingredients and perfect tortillas,  To top it all off, they have bottled house made sauces that are excellent.

I’d like to start off with how amazing it was to come here for dinner! I had come here for my mothers 50th birthday and I don’t regret it at all! The area is very clean and organized. The food was outstandingly tasty! For the quality of the food to me it’s 100% worth the buck.

Service was great!  Small restaurant and we went within the first hour of opening. Soup had a great flavor. Lasagna was over cooked and noodles were burnt and hard. Picture doesn’t show it since they put sauce on top to cover it. Special ravioli was good. The two shrimp dishes had no flavor and shrimp were overcooked and rubbery. Wouldn’t make this a go back again for the food.

The food was good, but the service is what really stood out. Our waiter was friendly, funny, and helped us out with recommendations. I had a salad and the basil pesto pasta and it was great and a reasonable price

First time here... ate with 8 other family members (all eat gluten).  They gluten dishes apparently were very good.  My husband and I got gluten free versions of two dishes.  The frutti de Mar and the veal saltemboca.   Well, the descriptions in the menu were WAY off on both dishes for the GF versions.  I did not like the Frutti del Mar at all.  Super vinegar flavor and BLAND BLAND BLAND.   There wasn't enough salt and pepper to fix it.  The Saltimboca was good flavor with the sauce but the veggies were also BLAND on their own.  Thankfully the sauce really did help the veggies.  It was "just okay".  It would have been nice to be warned that the GF versions were so different that the menu description.

The reviews I read pumped up my expectations. Walking up the cute little side drive and into the cozy space was nice. But it was all down hill from there. It was my first visit so I ordered things that were highlighted as restaurant specialties. The Calamari Fritti was not elevated in anyway. Basic at best. The Polenta Croccante was actually a great choice but my polenta was not crispy as described & that really took away from the dish. The Insalata Caprese was simple but it’s described as over mixed greens but a romaine/spinach mix didn’t sit right with me and I didn’t pick up on any Italian red wine vinaigrette. But the biggest disappointment was the Risotto con Aragosta e Zafferano. Risotto is not a soup. I literally had a spoon full of liquid. And on top of that, it was flavorless. All I tasted was fishy seafood. We didn’t even finish it. The staff & service was fine. We were seated next to 2 ladies who are regulars… So I assume there’s potential. But based on my first experience… there’s nothing I’d return for. Oh, and we got a donut like dessert that was deep fried, greasy, and flavorless. That was our cherry on top. No thank you.

It was really busy on a Saturday night but everyone was friendly and the food was amazing! I ordered the MCM Chef's Special: Ravioli du Zucca and the creamy sauce and perfectly made ravioli just delicious. The restaurant itself is warm and welcoming. Indoor and outdoor seating available. I really recommend it.

Hadn't been to one of these in years and years. The menu's a bit bigger and the pizzas are still delicious. The Jamaican Jerk Chicken pizza was sweet and spicy. The chicken dumplings were great with a very tasty, tangy sauce. Decent beer selection and the sangria flight was fun to try.

First time going to California Pizza Kitchen. The buffalo cauliflower was tasty and the sauce below it was good too. I liked the flavor of the seafood cioppino, slightly oily. The pizza was better than the pasta in my opinion.

Went here for my birthday.  Food was good.  They switched from actual menus to the QR code.  But overall, I enjoyed myself.  The waitress was kind enough to add the candle when my daughter told her it was my birthday.😊

We stop here for dinner with a group of 47. Even though our group could be considered “big” the service was just great. They were really for us, the food was out in a split, and attention to detail was just perfect. Thanks for your help and service.
I believe responding to my post earned the extra star. So, 5 star review, is well deserved.

March 2023:  Stopped by CPK today and had the Jambalaya.  It's very good 👍 and spicy.  One of my favorite dished.  Been a CPK customer for 30 years, including the CPKnin the Beverly Center.  Recommended dining.  ☆☆☆ 1/2.

Good Stuff Eatery is a solid choice if you’re looking for something relatively quick with burger choices that will fit everyone’s dietary needs. But, we were disappointed in the size of the burger patties, given the price of the burger. Also the flavor left much to be desired. They do offer various flavorful sauces to add to the burger and fries though. Overall, I would say the food is mediocre but the location and service is excellent.

This place had so many good reviews that I decided to give it a try. I was really craving a chicken sandwich but I should have looked at the yelp reviews as well. Truth be told my chicken sandwich was DRY and im not saying oh a little dry I mean VERY dry and hard. The ‘hot oil’ in the sandwich tasted like franks hot sauce; over all I wouldn’t get this item again. I also ordered the petals because i loved the idea of having onions like this; but just because it’s a good idea doesn’t mean it was executed well. I was served onion petals that had raw batter. I really wanted to like this place.

Good Stuff Eatery serves fantastic burgers, great farmers market salads and great shakes and floats. The atmosphere is cool and service is decent. Definitely a good place to eat! Parking in the neighborhood is a challenge unless you park in the adjacent parking garage which after 4:00 pm is free.

Tasty food in a lovely neighborhood! There is tons of space for seating. The Nashville Hot Chicken Sandwich is very tasty as is the Cherry Blossom milkshake! Food came out fast and hot. The salads were also a hit with my mom and grandma.
The fried green tomato burger veg was a little mushy for my taste, but the fries and red velvet shake were soooooo good. Will try a regular burger next time. Love.

name: Nando's PERi-PERi
vicinity: 1301 South Joyce Street Suite D10, Arlington

reviews.text: Always bring back memories from my living in the UK. Chicken Brest grilled with hot spicy sauce alternative available from mild to extra hot. Had it with two sides of pumpkin and corn as well as Spanish rice. The drink was bloody orange with mango and lemonade and cost $19. Everything was delicious and enjoyable evening with a friendly polite staff.

Love Nando's, but this location made my experience absolutely AWFUL!! Poor customer service, staff not wanting to do their job, and staff complaining to each other about my request to bring the chicken to an edible standard. The chairs were a bit dirty and could benefit from a good cleaning. The music was really loud!! I was very disappointed, would not recommend,  and would not return.

We went to celebrate my wife’s birthday. The location is wonderful. Nearby you have a skating place where your kids can really enjoy. The restaurant is clean with caring staffs. The food was awesome. Moreover in the same location you have other bars and restaurants to choose. I would recommend it. Nice family restaurant.

I had the Mango & Lime chicken bowl and a side order of fries; both items were delicious.  The season on the fries is simply yummy. Will definitely visit them again.  The manager was very nice, courtesy and extremely helpful when asking questions about the various dishes.
Rosslyn location.

The greeter had some serious passive aggressive attitude as I walked in. Was very annoyed that I wanted to order inside vs using the app and it got worse as our visit progressed.
This has happened on several previous visits with the same individual as well.

The food was good though.

Epic Smokehouse was good. The staff was very friendly and attentive. The place wasn't crowded which was nice. The food was good I got the pulled pork brisket and the bourbon bread pudding. I had to put a little extra season (salt) on it. It was honestly bland but the salt made it taste better. The bread pudding was pretty good. The only reason I am giving it a 4 star rating is because there was a fly going around around the restaurant and my friend's utensils were dirty.

Service was great and most of the food was not too bad.  But at these prices I would expect better.  Again there was nothing wrong with the meal, just that nothing really stood out...
The medium rare was closer to rare and that glaze just kind of ruined that 40 dollar rib eye.
Still..I'd come back and give it another shot.  It's definitely a step or two above Longhorn & Outback.

1st timer & I liked it. Service was good, our waiter was super nice. The quantity of food they serve is great enough too fill you up or leftovers. Plenty of stress parking. It's kinda hide by the tress in case you miss it. They have indoor & outdoor seating. Will definitely be back. Check it out.

Good BBQ food in the heart of Pentagon City. The staff is excellent and left a happy camper. The Smoker section has a lot of good choices. Felt like the food was dense so you’ll definitely have room for leftovers tomorrow - depending on what you get. Recommend trying this place.

Yes! Yes! A thousand times, yes! If you like meat, this is where you need to be. Meat galore at the Palace of Meat. The burnt ends appetizer was so good. Their ribs are ridiculously tasty and the homemade sausage is amazing. Add to that a Candied Bacon Bourbon Old Fashioned and there's no better place to consume large quantities of meat. Meat!

Just like some other reviews here, the medium burger I ordered came well done. It was almost a hockey puck quality. The staff is nice when you can find someone to take your order. They also have a fruit fly problem in November?
There isn't much to choose from for food if you don't have a car or pay for delivered food.
Oh yeah, the pizzas are the best thing on the menu!🍕🍕
The food was really good and it came faster than I thought. The sprite had a very nice different taste and our servant was so sweet, would recommend and would love to come back

Staff is nice.  Ordered a burger with cheddar... it came with Swiss, no bacon, (which per the menu it should have had)
Patties were charred, not in a good way, tasted burnt, texture of the beef patties was dense, obviously frozen... and had no seasoning.  Could not eat it.  Bun tasted stale.   The French fries were perfect!  Which is why I gave a 2 instead of a 1.  We were a but stuck and had to eat here or uber.... I should have ordered uber eats!

Based on my experience one night, i would not recommend this restaurant. They were overwhelmed so service was slow. And the food was not good. It actually was quite terrible unfortunately. I had the hummus and pita chips which were greasy and hard. They may have just had a bad night.

I was absolutely devastated after ordering from here ,

We were going to stay in this hotel for the night so I was hungry and reached for the menu , well as expected there was nothing pleasing for the vegetarians.

I made up my mind to order 'Baked potatoes' after taking alot of time. I decided to collect it from the restaurant as it was given in box , as I opened the box I was shocked! I had never expected to see such a bland peice of dish anyone could ever serve. It was just one potato cut in the middle with 2 dippings which were more horrible.

I just took once slice with the curd based dip and left the entire box . It was one of the worst experiences I have ever had and surely I have learnt a lesson here after this.
